definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Many were ashamed of having gone so meekly.
sentences.chinese: 许多人对自己当时如此逆来顺受感到羞愧。

sentences.english: One lady says she hates a man who is too weak and too submissive.
sentences.chinese: 一位女士说她讨厌那种很懦弱和逆来顺受的男人。
我要逆来顺受，忍气吞声强作欢笑。

sentences.english: Why do people stay in relationships that are violent?
sentences.chinese: 为什么还要在暴力中逆来顺受？

sentences.english: Or do you just grin and bear it?
sentences.chinese: 或者你只是在逆来顺受的工作？

sentences.english: Sanshui at the meeting, the more and meet wave red she resigned.
sentences.chinese: 三水在会上遇见飘红，更与她逆来顺受。

sentences.english: Another advantage of people as subjects in nature programmes is that they are biddable.
sentences.chinese: 另一项此类自然节目观众的优势在于他们逆来顺受。

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to be content with one's lot (idiom)/to know one's place
to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence

Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
to bear patiently/to endure silently/to forbear
